Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2010 05:47AM dontknowwhy wrote: Hi, Alice!  I am so sorry that you find yourself here, but please know you are not alone.  I was diagnosed BC after just turning 30.  33, I was diagnosed with mets to the lung and recently at 34, mets to the brain.  I have a 10 year old son. Unfortunately, cancer can spread very quickly.  I know you must be in shock and I can completely understand the anger.  I'm still very angry.  Doctors, I've heard tales, typically don't believe that young women can get breast cancer...not sure where they hell they've been.  It seems that they put off checking into and by then, its progressed.  These doctors need to get to a breast cancer conference asap.  Again, I'm so sorry. You might want to find a support group to talk to or possibly, a therapist?  I'm searching for a support group in my area because while I've been trying to handle this all myself, I really need help.  Family and friends try to help, but for the most part, don't get it.  They either minimize it because they think that will make it go away or they go the other extreme and make you feel like cancer girl.  Neither are very helpful...at least for me.  There are lots of treatment options.  Do not lose HOPE.  To borrow a phrase from a wonderful woman, there is no expiration date stamped on your foot.  Live and fight this nasty beast with everything that you have. Another website that caters to young breast cancer survivors is youngsurvival.org.  Its a place for women in diagnosed in their 20s and 30s.  Just as here, there are lots of great and wise women to vent to and to ask for help. I'm sorry that you're here, but I'm glad that you found us.  If there is anything you want to talk about or vent about, please feel free to pm me or anyone else.  Everyone is very friendly and wants to help. (((hugs)))  Holly
Posts.Title: Serious denial... texasrose361 texasrose361

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2010 12:36PM dontknowwhy wrote: I'm so sorry that you are dealing with this.  I hope they get you feeling better ASAP!! You are in my prayers!! Holly

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2010 06:02AM dontknowwhy wrote: (((Diane))) I was in the processing of preparing for reconstruction when the first diagnosis of mets happened.  I was actually getting ready to try reconstruction again, when the second diagnosis of mets happened.  Seriously?!  Not only will we keep fighting, but we will get reconstruction...eventually! I agree with Carole that sometimes you need a break from the boards...as well as a break from any kind of breast cancer research.  We make our own statistics!! Holly As the rest of the ladies have said, we are here for you!!

Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Jun 29, 2010 07:29AM dontknowwhy wrote: Hey, Dorothy!  I'm wondering the same thing.  Brain mets came on with a passion with nausea and vomiting.  Started the steroids and things seem to get a bit better....at least my head didn't feel like it was going to fall off.  Last week, I started with the first 4 of 14 WBR treatments.  I had days where I felt ok, but for the most part, I felt exactly how you described.  Just overwhelming tired and with a hangover without the benefits of the fun the night before.   After radiation, I take a nap and then wake up around 10 and am up until around2.  I actually feel pretty decent during this time, but not a heck of a lot I can do, ya know?   so yesterday, I felt decent and today I feel like I've been rolled over by a mac truck.  I'm trying to stay posivitive and that within a few more days, the steroids will take hold and I'll feel like me again. (I sincerely hope).  Cause right now, I just want to lay down and take a nap....a loooooonnnnggg nap!!  Hope this helps some.  I'm sooo random right now. Anytime, you want to chat or anything, please feel free to pm me!!  Usually helps when someone else is going through something similar.  Best wishes!!!!   Holly
Posts.Title: Please tell me this will get easier (wbr) dorfar pee

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2010 04:22PM dontknowwhy wrote: Hi, Joyce! I was diagnosed with brain mets in June 2010.  The mri showed lots of lesions in my brain so I had no other option than 14 treatments of WBR.  The follow up mri showed a slight improvement (not terribly thrilled with that) and a recent mri showed that the brain mets were stable (again, not terribly thrilled).  I'm currently on Abraxane for my lungs.  Honestly, there hasn't been too much talk about the brain mets since.  I went to MD Anderson for a follow up opinion and they found two spots on my spinal cord, which was 10 radiation treatments.  I'm going back for follow at the end of November.  Hopefully, I'll have more information then.   I'm happy for your daughter that her hair is growing back from WBR...mine isn't growing. :-( "Bump" is when a topic is moved to the top so that it can be read by those that haven't had a chance to see it. I wish you both the best!! Holly
Posts.Title: Brain Mets treatment Poll Joyce4123 marieibrahim

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2010 04:43PM dontknowwhy wrote: I think you're right to question it.  A pet scan has never showed cancer in my body even tho there has been.  My tumor markers always slowly increase.  They went from 28 to 38 in three months and the ct scan showed the tumor in my lung, but the pet scan did not.  Neither the ct scan nor the pet scan showed that the tumor was far more aggressive than we had originally thought. I had a pet scan and a ct scan about 5 weeks prior to being diagnosed with brain mets.  Neither scan showed anything in the brain, but the ct scan showed another spot in the lung.  The only reason we found it is because I got very nauseous and sick.  So I get nervous when the tumor markers are rising and the scans show nothing.  The brain mri showed that I had a spider web of lesions on my brain.  Just finished whole brain radiation.  My tumor markers are still going up.  I started femara about a month ago.  My onc wants to see if the tumor marker stabilizes before we decide what to do next. Anyway, that's just my experience.  Everyone is different.  I'm sending you positive thoughts that your tumor markers start descending and your next scans are clear!
Posts.Title: Tumor Marker Increase...Slowly but Surely lukejessesmom susan_02143
